channel.title: BCScanner
channel.description:
i made this like 5 months ago.
scans bytecode for malicious content. added a nice little gui for it to go along.
you can try it out [url=http://abraham2119.net63.net/bcscan.html]here[/url]
pic of me scanning runescape's 554 client revision: [img]http://i32.tinypic.com/qs6uj5.png][/img]
@moparisthebest: feel free to upload it to your site if you wish, seeing as ikilliki did the same.
note: you have to add bcel to your classpath in order for it to compile feel free to add your own scanners to it.
current scanners: connections, external libs, file interaction, processes (shell)
source is attached.
couldnt be fucked to make it scan on a thread other than the edt, so dont rant
edit: added pic to prevent ranting.

item.title: BCScanner
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

You are scanning for only a few types of potentially malignant code.

If you really want to create an awesome scanner, base it on java.security.Permission. Look at all the sub-types of [tt]Permission[/tt] and their usage in the Java API.

Read full topic

item.title: BCScanner
item.dc:creator: @abraham2119 abraham2119
item.description:
@abraham2119 wrote:

[quote=“la­wl, post:2, topic:297576”]could easily get around this using reflection[/quote]i was thinking of putting a reflection scanner while i was making it, but i forgot. cant be fucked to make it now.

but ya, that would stop ur hax

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @lawl lawl
item.description:
@lawl wrote:

could easily get around this using reflection
